intro: Gouldia konaensis, commonly known as the Kona gouldia, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical climates. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, colorful flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
